committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests
Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands

official_title: A bill to authorize a study of methods to protect and interpret the nationally significant fossil trackways found in the Robledo Mountains near Las Cruces, New Mexico.

summary.text: Prehistoric Trackways Study Act of 1990 - Withdraws approximately 736 acres in the Robledo Mountains and surrounding areas in New Mexico from entry, appropriation, or disposal under the public land laws, and from location, entry, or patent under the mining laws, but not from operation under the mineral leasing laws, for two years after transmittal of the study mandated by this Act. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study of the alternatives for the protection and interpretation of the fossil resources of the area. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to authorize a study of methods to protect and interpret the nationally significant fossil trackways found in the Robledo Mountains near Las Cruces, New Mexico.
